properties.name: Golden Garden
properties.popupContent: Be awed by the full splendour of three Supertrees clad in a bright visual spectacle of gold and yellow coloured bromeliads.

properties.name: Flower Dome
properties.popupContent:
Step into the Flower Dome and be amazed by changing display of flowers and plants from the Mediterranean and semi-arid regions.

Closed once a month for maintenance. View closure dates here.

Admission charge applies. Buy tickets here

properties.name: Cloud Forest
properties.popupContent:
Enter the Cloud Forest and take in breath-taking mountain views surrounded by diverse vegetation and hidden floral gems.

Closed once a month for maintenance. View closure dates here.

Admission charge applies. Buy tickets here

properties.name: Floral Fantasy
properties.popupContent:
Flowers, artistry and technology come together at Floral Fantasy to create a dream-like, fantastical experience for visitors. It comprises four diverse garden landscapes, each showcasing a different concept, as well as a 4D ride.

Closed once a month for maintenance. View closure dates here.

Admission charge applies. Buy tickets here

properties.name: OCBC Skyway
properties.popupContent:
Stroll along the 22-metre-high OCBC Skyway and enjoy panoramic vistas of the Gardens and the Marina Bay skyline.

Closed once a month for maintenance. View closure dates here.

Admission charge applies. Buy tickets here

properties.name: Supertree Grove
properties.popupContent: Measuring between 25 and 50 metres tall, Gardens by the Bay's Supertrees are designed with large canopies that provide shade in the day and come alive with an exhilarating display of lights and sounds at night.
properties.openingHours:
CLOSURE OF SUPERTREE GROVE
Supertree Grove will be closed from 5.30pm to 10.30pm from now till 2 Jan 2022 due to Christmas Wonderland.
Open daily: 5.00am - 2.00am

properties.name: Discovery
properties.popupContent: Venture into this realm of lush greenery and learn all about the spectacular myriad of tropical plants and the systems these plants support.

properties.name: Web of Life
properties.popupContent: Take in the impressive sight of life-sized topiary animals such as the orang-utan, pangolin and hornbill that have been woven from fig.

properties.name: Fruits and Flowers
properties.popupContent: Take a walk amongst an amazing variety of colourful flowers and fruits, enjoy the sweet scent of blossoms in season and check out the tantalising array of fruits growing in abundance in this charming garden.

properties.name: Understorey
properties.popupContent: At the Understorey, find out all about how decomposers break down fallen leaves, twigs and flowers to produce much-needed nutrients for the ecosystem.

properties.name: World of Palms
properties.popupContent: Meet a colourful array of tropical lowland palms, each with its unique form, shape and stature at the World of Palms.

properties.name: Secret Life of Trees
properties.popupContent: At the Secret Life of Trees, discover all about the variety of swaying green giants that thrive in Singapore, and learn about the challenges they face to survive in tropical countries.

properties.name: Indian Garden
properties.popupContent: Visit the Indian Garden, laid out in the shape of a traditional folk art floral motif design known as Kolam. Discover the garden's inspired, vibrant motifs and lush fauna, representing life and aspects of daily Indian culture.

properties.name: Chinese Garden
properties.popupContent: Take a stroll through the Chinese Garden and discover a balanced landscape where art imitates nature, with the use of rocks to resemble mountains, water features to resemble rivers and waterfalls, or pruning and training trees to appear windswept.

properties.name: Malay Garden
properties.popupContent: Know more about the Malays and how cultivation plays a vital part in their daily lives. The Malay Garden features an array of plants and alternative vegetables, providing raw material and medicine for the community.

properties.name: Colonial Garden
properties.popupContent: Singapore's geographical position on the Spice Route made it her centre of the spice and cash crop trade. Explore the Colonial Garden and discover some of the aromatic plants from her colonial past, including Cloves, Nutmeg, Rubber, Oil Palm, Coffee and Cocoa Trees.

properties.name: Serene Garden
properties.popupContent: A tranquil 2-hectare space located just a stone’s throw from The Meadow, visitors can get a brief respite from the hustle and bustle of the city life as they enjoy an intimate encounter with nature at Serene Garden.

properties.name: Sun Pavilion
properties.popupContent: Take a walk through the Sun Pavilion and marvel at the amazing desert-like landscapes. With over 1,000 desert plants comprising some 100 different species and varieties, the Sun Pavilion is nothing short of extraordinary.

properties.name: Far East Organization Children's Garden
properties.popupContent: Have a fun-filled family day with interactive play delights, water play features and educational programmes in a lush natural setting at Far East Organization Children’s Garden.
properties.openingHours:
Thu - Sun: 9.00am - 7.00pm
Last admission: 6.00pm
Closed every Mon to Wed unless it is a public holiday.

School Holidays: 9.00am - 7.00pm
Last admission: 6.00pm
Closed every Mon during School Holidays

properties.name: The Canyon
properties.popupContent: Be in awe of the rocks’ naturally intriguing shapes and imposing sizes which stand out against the surrounding backdrop of the Cooled Conservatories. Adding to the exotic appeal are 200 plant species unique to arid regions, as well as four mystical sculptures in the form of a giant dragonfly, a metal dragon and two Chinese totems.

properties.name: Silver Garden
properties.popupContent: Under the canopy of silver-hued Supertrees, Silver Garden overlooks the Dragonfly Lake.

properties.name: Dragonfly Lake
properties.popupContent: Find out how Dragonfly Lake plays a vital role in supporting the aquatic ecosystem and the Gardens' sustainability as you stroll along the 400-metre boardwalk.

properties.name: Kingfisher Lake
properties.popupContent: The Kingfisher Lake is one of the two lakes integral to the lake system and environmental sustainability at the Gardens. The Kingfisher Lake rich source of aquatic life plays a vital role in ensuring better water quality by acting as a natural eco-filter and strategically located aquatic reeds also act as filter beds.

properties.name: Bay East Garden
properties.popupContent: With glorious views of the Marina Bay skyline, Bay East Garden offers scenic tranquility in the city.

properties.name: Cafe Crema
properties.popupContent: Savour a cup of artisanal coffee and gourmet sandwiches or delight in our Japanese creations, while enjoying the splendour of the Supertrees from Cafe Crema.

properties.name: McDonald's
properties.popupContent: Enjoy the familiar tastes of your McDonald’s Favourites right here at the Gardens!

properties.name: Bakerzin
properties.popupContent: A casual dining cafe specialising in desserts, you'll be spoilt for choice with Bakerzin's wide array of cakes, pastries, and savoury offerings.

properties.name: Conservatory Cafe
properties.popupContent: The Conservatory Cafe offers 17 flavours of delectable premium ice-creams, delicious treats and thirst-quenching drinks that will make your visit to the Gardens truly unforgettable.

properties.name: Majestic Bay Seafood Restaurant
properties.popupContent: A Chinese seafood restaurant, Majestic Bay offers the freshest underwater catch and magnificent views of the Marina Bay waterfront.
properties.openingHours:
Open daily
Lunch: 11.30am - 3.00pm (last order at 2.45pm)
Dinner: 5.30pm - 9.00pm (last order at 8.45pm)

properties.name: Marguerite
properties.popupContent: Taking root amidst the lush garden surrounds of the Flower Dome, Marguerite by Chef/Owner Michael Wilson embraces the best of the seasons with tasting menus that celebrate craft, provenance and produce through contemporary cuisine. Fine wines, innovative temperance beverages and a personalised level of service that exudes warmth, ease and charm complement a fine dining experience of true exception.
properties.openingHours:
Wed – Thu

Dinner
6.00pm – 10.00pm (last seating at 8.00pm)

Fri - Sun
Lunch
12.00pm – 3.00pm (last seating at 1.30pm)
Dinner
6.00pm – 10.00pm (last seating at 8.00pm)
Closed every Monday and Tuesday

properties.name: Jurassic Nest Food Hall
properties.popupContent: The latest addition to Gardens by the Bay’s dining offerings, Jurassic Nest is the first of its kind in Singapore. More than just a themed food hall, Jurassic Nest is also an edu-tainment and lifestyle destination for the whole family.

properties.name: Petit Coco @ Children's Garden Cafe
properties.popupContent: Located in Far East Organization Children's Garden, this casual cafe serves delicious bento meals and light snacks for adults and children alike. Perfect when you need an energy boost while watching your kids play!

properties.name: Satay by the Bay
properties.popupContent:
Bond with friends and family over local delights, while enjoying the views of the waterfront at Satay by the Bay.

Open with selected stalls:
Marina Live Seafood, Makan by the Bay (Halal, closed on Mondays), Thai Cuisine, Huat Huat chicken wings, GeyLang Lor 29 Hokkien Mee, 26 @ Marina Live Seafood (Steam boat), Satay stalls, Drink stall

properties.name: Hopscotch (New!)
properties.popupContent: Hopscotch - your gateway to a Singaporean-themed artisanal cocktails and delectable Singaporean fusion food fare. A restaurant and craft cocktail bar celebrating the simpler pleasures of life; a gathering of close friends and family over a scrumptious spread of food and drinks.

properties.name: Toilet (Inside Flower Dome)
properties.popupContent: Admission ticket to Flower Dome is required to use this toilet.

properties.name: Toilet (Inside Cloud Forest)
properties.popupContent: Admission ticket to Cloud Forest is required to use this toilet.

properties.name: Floral Fantasy Gift Shop
properties.popupContent: Click here for more details here.

properties.name: Conservatory Gift Shop
properties.popupContent:
Pick up souvenirs and last-minute gifts from a wide range of merchandise suitable for loved ones of all ages.
Find out more here.

properties.name: Arrival Gift Shop
properties.popupContent:
Bring home your very own Gardens by the Bay merchandise with a range of plant collections from the Arrival Gift Shop.
Find out more here.

properties.name: Bayfront Plaza Carpark
properties.popupContent: Basement carpark

properties.name: Main Entrance Basement Carpark
properties.popupContent: Open-air carpark

properties.name: Satay by The Bay Carpark
properties.popupContent: Open-air carpark

properties.name: The Meadow Carpark
properties.popupContent: Open-air carpark

properties.popupContent: Open-air carpark

properties.name: Friends of The Gardens Centre

properties.openingHours: Closed till further notice, please proceed to Ticketing Counter 4 at The Canopy for assistance.

properties.name: The Canopy Visitor Service Centre
properties.popupContent: Click here for more details here.

properties.name: The Wyvern
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Magnificent Bull
properties.popupContent: Sited at the Arrival Square of the Gardens, this strong bronze cast bull sculpture by renowned American sculptor Walter Matia (b. 1953) displays a vigour that aptly depicts Singapore’s bullish economy.

properties.name: The Giant Snail
properties.popupContent:
Admission to the attraction is required

Wonderfully captured by contemporary Australian artist Will Wilson, a bronze cast of an oversized snail stands among the beds of multi-coloured of begonias growing in the shady and humid Secret Garden.

properties.name: Ants on Trees
properties.popupContent: Climbing all over our “peek-a-boo” trees made from the hollow trunks of Bishop Wood (Bischofia javanica), these curious ants seem to be hard at work and are a favourite with our young visitors.

properties.name: Dragonfly Riders
properties.popupContent: A landmark feature within the tranquil Dragonfly Lake, these magnificent giant dragonflies sculptures with casts of children riding on their backs, measure 5m by 6m. The laser-cut meshed pattern used on the wings of the dragonflies encases colourful art glass, which gives an overall fascinating abstract effect.

properties.name: Diaspora
properties.popupContent: Named Diaspora, or li xiang (离乡), which means “to leave one’s native place”, this two-piece sculpture pays homage to early Chinese immigrants who had journeyed to Singapore in search of a better life.

properties.name: Guardian Lions
properties.popupContent: The two pairs of guardian lions placed to welcome visitors at both ends of the Supertree Grove are a prime example of traditional Chinese sculpture.

properties.name: Planet
properties.popupContent: A hefty seven tons, this impressive bronze sculpture is 9m long and 3m tall. It portrays an oversized reproduction of the artist's own son, Lucas, as a baby.

properties.name: La Famille de Voyageurs
properties.popupContent:
Admission to the attraction is required

Inspired by the universal theme of travel, French sculptor Bruno Catalano’s eye-catching works, with their dashed bodies and the deliberate lack of volume, invite the viewer to mentally reconstruct the possibility of the human potential.

properties.name: Floral Clock
properties.popupContent: This seven-metre-wide Floral Clock draws inspiration from the signature characteristics of Audemars Piguet's Royal Oak collection and fuses traditional and contemporary landscaping elements in its design.

properties.name: Eastern Cowboys
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Totems and Horse
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: The Rush of Nature
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Upright Totems
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Bifurcate Totems
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Boots and Sailors
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Mosaic Crocodile
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Pale Crocodile
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Simba
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Multiple Maternity
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Ladies Heads
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Parting...
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Warriors
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: Lion Doors
properties.popupContent: Admission to the attraction is required

properties.name: The Eagle Has Landed
properties.popupContent:
Admission to the attraction is required

Cleverly crafted from the polished and varnished Lychee roots, this commanding eagle is supported by a plain Lychee tree stump. The eagle has a reputation as a fierce hunter in the sky and its name also resembles the Chinese word for “hero”.

properties.name: Trio of Kingfishers
properties.popupContent: Comprising two kingfisher sculptures in a perching stance and one in a flight position, the Trio of Kingfishers is given pride of place at the Kingfisher Lake, one of the more tranquil and relaxing spots in the Gardens.

properties.name: Moongate
properties.popupContent: Standing at 3.8m, Moongate features an upright bronze ring with a uniquely textured inner surface modelled after abstract shapes that draw inspiration from the phenomena of our constantly changing natural world, such as shifting sands, tongues of flames, and the changing form of clouds.

properties.name: Fiore
properties.popupContent: Fiore is particularly captivating with an extensive headdress composed with flora and fauna that are reminiscent of Henri Matisse’s still-lifes. Valdés’s works are highly inspired by nature.

properties.name: The Sea Shell
properties.popupContent: Influenced by historical masterpieces, Valdés creates large works in which the lighting and colours express a sensation of tactility.

properties.name: Ferns
properties.popupContent: Influenced by historical masterpieces, Valdés creates large works in which the lighting and colours express a sensation of tactility.

properties.name: Bayfront Plaza Ticketing Counter
properties.popupContent:
Click here for more details here.



Buy tickets here.
properties.openingHours: Closed until further notice. Please buy your admission tickets online.

properties.name: Stairs (Supertree Grove, near World of Plants)
Supertree Observatory
properties.popupContent:
Located at the canopy of the tallest Supertree at Supertree Grove, visitors can soak in unblocked cityscape views at our open-air rooftop deck, enjoy light refreshments and try out immersive digital learning experiences inside our observatory space.

Admission charge applies. Limited tickets can be purchased from a self-service Ticketing kiosk at the attraction entrance.
properties.openingHours:
Daily: 9.00am - 9.00pm
(Last admission at 8.30pm)

Recommended Visit Duration: 45 mins

properties.name: Supertree Observatory Cafe (Inside Supertree Observatory)
properties.popupContent: Cap your day off with some light refreshments at Supertree Observatory Cafe, while you relax and enjoy magnificent views of the city skyline! A variety of refreshments such as cocktails, mocktails, soft drinks and light snacks, are available on the menu.

properties.name: Toilet (Inside Supertree Observatory)
properties.popupContent: Admission ticket to Supertree Observatory is required to use this toilet.

properties.name: Nursing Room (Inside Cloud Forest after going down the escalator from Crystal Mountain)
properties.popupContent: Admission ticket to Cloud Forest is required.

properties.name: Nursing Room (Floral Fantasy inside Gift Shop)
properties.popupContent: Admission ticket to Floral Fantasy is required.

properties.name: Ficus Room
properties.popupContent: Ficus Room is a multipurpose space suitable for all types of corporate events ranging from seminars, workshops to even product launches. It is also situated at Active Garden, which provides additional venue spaces at Waterfront Plaza, Active Garden Lawn and Moongate Lawn — giving you more options for your events.

properties.name: Active Garden
properties.popupContent: The all-new Active Garden embodies Gardens by the Bay’s vision of being a 'People’s Garden’.  Designed to bring together people of all ages and all walks of life, Active Garden is our latest outdoor social hub where there is something for everyone. The perfect playground for the young or young at heart, this is an ideal communal space for people across generations to relax and bond in a lush, waterfront setting. Pets are welcome, too!

properties.name: Shake Shack
properties.popupContent: Shake Shack is a modern day “roadside” burger stand known for its delicious burgers, chicken, hotdogs, frozen custard,beer, wine and more.
properties.openingHours:
Mon - Thu: 10.30am - 9.00pm
Fri, PH eve: 10.00am - 10.00pm
Sat, Sun, PH: 9.30am- 10.00pm

properties.name: Starbucks
properties.popupContent: A neighbourhood friendly gathering place to meet friends and family over cups of coffe and delicious food.
properties.openingHours:
Mon - Thu: 8.30am - 10.30pm
Fri & Eve of PH: 8.30am - 11.00pm
Sat: 8.00am - 11.00pm
Sun: 8.00am - 10.30pm

properties.name: Social Kitchen
properties.popupContent: The Social Kitchen is a new dining concept with a mission to benefit the vulnerable community by creating jobs through food. Admission tickets to Supertree Observatory are required.

properties.name: Mylo's
properties.popupContent: The namesake of Churner-in-Chief Michael Wilson’s golden retriever, Mylo’s celebrates gathering with family, friends and your beloved pets. Fresh bakes and coffee, classic sarnies, cheeky tipples and over 20 seasonal gelatos made onsite are the order of the day at the newest pet-friendly cafe in town!
properties.openingHours:
Wed - Thu: 8.00am - 8.00pm
Fri - Sun: 8.00am - 10.00pm

Walk-ins only

Closed every Monday & Tuesday

properties.name: Moongate Lawn (Event Venue)
properties.popupContent: The Moongate Lawn is located at Active Garden along the waterfront promenade. It offers a beautiful landscape space with breathtaking views of the Marina Channel and the city skyline. Surrounded by the waterfront and lush open lawns, the Moongate Lawn is perfect for whatever event you can think of.

properties.name: Active Garden Lawn (Event Venue)
properties.popupContent: Whatever event you may be planning, Active Garden Lawn is the ideal place to hold it. With Marina Bay Sands and the Singapore Flyer as your backdrop, this lush open space makes it the postcard-perfect venue. There’s really no other place to be.

properties.name: Waterfront Plaza (Event Venue)
properties.popupContent: Located in Active Garden, Waterfront Plaza offers a sheltered open space with breathtaking views of Marina Bay and the city skyline. It’s the perfect venue for special-themed events, fancy cocktail receptions, or even team building events.

properties.name: Hortus
properties.popupContent: Casual Mediterranean cuisine by Michelin star chef Michael Wilson.
properties.openingHours:
Open from Wednesdays to Sundays only
10.00am - 10.00pm (Last order 9.00pm)

Closed every Monday and Tuesday

properties.name: The Meadow
properties.popupContent: Singapore’s largest outdoor garden event space, The Meadow offers a standing capacity of up to 30,000^ people.

properties.name: Kingfisher Wetlands
properties.popupContent: For bird watchers and nature photographers, the Kingfisher Wetlands never disappoints. The Gardens’ latest attraction, this new freshwater sanctuary opens the eye to a flourishing diversity of exotic flora and fauna.

properties.name: Bicycle Parking (Waterfront Promenade near Active Garden)
Garden Pod
properties.popupContent: Located just a few minutes from Singapore’s new downtown at Marina Bay, an immersive garden stay awaits.

events.name: Avatar: The Experience
events.eventDescription: Set at Cloud Forest with its iconic vision of waterfalls, spiraling walkways and a unique architectural glass greenhouse, Avatar: The Experience invites guests to connect with the alien world of Pandora, its bioluminescent environments, mystical creatures, flora, and the captivating culture of its indigenous people, the Na’vi.

events.name: Nature and Sustainability Tours
events.openingHours:
Check out this page for more details
Date & Time
Every Sat and Sun
8.30am ‐ 9.30am and
10.30am ‐ 11.30am
events.eventDescription: Join our guided walking tours to learn about the importance and interconnectedness of the natural environment, biodiversity and climate change.

events.name: Pokégenic in Gardens by the Bay!
events.eventDescription: Various photogenic Pokémon are waiting to be discovered in Gardens by the Bay. Strike your best pose, take some photos and be Pokégenic!

events.name: Seeing the Invisible
events.eventDescription:
Seeing the Invisible at Gardens by the Bay features augmented reality works by 12 international artists including Ai Weiwei, Refik Anadol, El Anatsui, Isaac Julien CBE RA, Mohammed Kazem, Sigalit Landau, Sarah Meyohas, Pamela Rosenkranz and Timur Si-Qin.
Engage with ‘Seeing the Invisible’ via an app designed for the exhibition that can be downloaded on smartphones and tablets, to view artworks through their devices and even interact with some of the pieces.

events.name: Quick HIIT
events.openingHours:
Every Thurs
7.00pm - 8.00pm

Every Sat
6.00pm - 7.00pm
Free admission
Register via the Healthy 365 mobile app
events.eventDescription: Led by professional trainers, Quick HIIT features short bursts of high intensity exercises that build muscles and burn calories in minimum time.

events.name: Active Family Programme
events.openingHours:
Every Sat
9.00am - 10.00am

Free admission
Register via the Healthy 365 mobile app
events.eventDescription: Active Family is an integrated programme that focus on fundamental movement skills development to promote bonding between both parent and child (4-6 years old) through the physical activity together as a family unit, with added on health education focusing on a healthy lifestyle.

advisory.advisoryDescription:
CLOSURE OF SUPERTREE GROVE
From 2 Dec 2022 to 1 Jan 2023, Supertree Grove will be closed from 5.30pm daily due to Christmas Wonderland. Certain routes might be affected.

CHANGES IN OPENING HOURS AND ADDITIONAL GARDEN RHAPSODY FROM 2 DEC 2022 TO 1 JAN 2023
Changes in Opening Hours and addition Garden Rhapsody show during the Festive Season (from 2 Dec 2022 to 1 Jan 2023). Find out more.

Please Turn On Browser Location Service

Enable Location Services in your device settings to navigate our Gardens via our Wayfinder app.

If you have already done so, please ignore this message.
